CHIEF:
Don!t worry, Dimitri Ivanovich, We can meet the plan
if -we can only keep men and machines going at the
present rate.
Three things and they're serious. That Doctor
Konevskaya at the clinic is giving out too many
certificates of illness to the workers. Then, our
Mechanical Engineer is pulling against us. He resists
pushing his machines so hard. And finally, many of
the workers are not fulfilling their work quotas.
They're tired.
They may be tired but they can give more. Let's get
the agitators working on this problem.
I?ll talk with the Party Secretary about the
agitators.
And I111 get to our Mechanical Engineer first thing
in the morning.
What about Doctor Konevskaya?
Evidently that reprimand was not enough. I think I!ll
drop in at the clinic tomorrow for a check-up and have
a little talk with her.
There1s something else. Those workers who belong to
the Communist Youth League, they're getting out of
hand.
(EXASPERATEDLY) Those kids, they're forever getting
carried away by their own slogans.
That's just the trouble. They1re making a pest of
themselves. Going around criticizing everybody and
everything in the factory. We better be on the
lookout tonight at the meeting.
